cards.name: Exeggcute
cards.text: Six of them together form a full-fledged Pokémon. It's often hunted by Crabrawler, but uses psychokinesis to drive it off.

attacks.name: Multiply
attacks.text: Search your deck for Exeggcute and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Alolan Exeggutor
cards.text: As it grew taller and taller, it outgrew its reliance on psychic powers, while within it awakened the power of the sleeping dragon.

attacks.name: Tropical Shake
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each type of basic Energy card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 100 damage in this way.

cards.name: Alolan Exeggutor
cards.text: As it grew taller and taller, it outgrew its reliance on psychic powers, while within it awakened the power of the sleeping dragon.

attacks.name: Tropical Shake
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each type of basic Energy card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 100 damage in this way.

cards.name: Snover
cards.text: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

attacks.name: Ice Shard
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Fighting Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Abomasnow

abilities.name: Blessings of the Frost
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may attach a Grass Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.text: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

attacks.name: Hypno Hammer
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Scatterbug

abilities.name: Abnormal Outbreak
abilities.text: You can use this Ability only if you go second. Once during your first turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Spewpa and a Vivillon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

cards.name: Scatterbug
cards.text: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

attacks.name: Ultra Evolution
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for Vivillon and put it onto this Scatterbug to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Spewpa
cards.text: The beaks of birds can't begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Vivillon
cards.text: The patterns on this Pokémon's wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

attacks.name: Vivid Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

cards.name: Skiddo
cards.text: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Gogoat
cards.text: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

attacks.name: Milk Drink
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Pheromosa
cards.text: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.

attacks.name: White Ray
attacks.text: If you have only 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Alolan Marowak
cards.text: Its custom is to mourn its lost companions. Mounds of dirt by the side of the road mark the graves of the Marowak.

attacks.name: Limbo Limbo
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Alolan Club
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon in play that has Alolan in its name.

cards.name: Heatran
cards.text: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Boiling Impact
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Fennekin
cards.text: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Fennekin
cards.text: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

cards.name: Braixen
cards.text: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Delphox

abilities.name: Mystical Torch
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Burned.

cards.text: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degree Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Litleo
cards.text: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.

cards.name: Pyroar

abilities.name: Unnerve
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent plays an Item or Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

cards.text: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride's cubs.

attacks.name: Dominating Fangs
attacks.text: If Lysandre Labs is in play, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Palkia-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spatial Control
attacks.text: Move any number of Energy from your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pressure
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zero Vanish-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle all Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Froakie

abilities.name: Frubbles
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

cards.name: Froakie
cards.text: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

cards.name: Frogadier

abilities.name: Gale Shuriken
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.

cards.name: Greninja-GX

abilities.name: Shuriken Flurry
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Haze Slash
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Shadowy Hunter-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 130 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Clauncher
cards.text: Through controlled expulsions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.

cards.name: Clawitzer
cards.text: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.

attacks.name: Standing By
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Sharpshooting attack does 120 damage instead of 40.

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Amaura
cards.text: This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Aurorus
cards.text: Using its diamond-shaped crystals, it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponent's attack.

attacks.name: Frost Wall
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Evolution Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blizzard Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Bergmite
cards.text: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.

attacks.name: Break Open
attacks.text: If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, discard it. If you do, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Avalugg
cards.text: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.

attacks.name: Frozen Ground
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Stadium cards from their hand during their next turn.

cards.name: Volcanion ◇

abilities.name: Jet Geyser
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Water Energy card from your hand. If you do, your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

attacks.name: Sauna Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Dewpider
cards.text: When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokémon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them.

attacks.name: Spider Web
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Araquanid
cards.text: Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokémon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Bubble Trap
attacks.text: If 1 of your Pokémon used Bubble during your last turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Magnemite
cards.text: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it's eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.

attacks.name: Searching Magnet
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Lightning Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Magneton
cards.text: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

cards.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Magnetic Circuit
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.text: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

cards.name: Helioptile
cards.text: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.

cards.name: Heliolisk
cards.text: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.

attacks.name: Volt Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Xurkitree
cards.text: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Cablegram
attacks.text: If you have exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Rotom

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

cards.text: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

attacks.name: Plasma Slice
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Uxie
cards.text: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.

attacks.name: Memory Skip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Mesprit

abilities.name: Silent Waves
abilities.text: If you have Azelf in play, your opponent's Pokémon in play have no Resistance.

cards.text: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake's surface.

attacks.name: Mind Splash
attacks.text: If Uxie is on your Bench, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Azelf
cards.text: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit and Azelf all came from the same egg.

attacks.name: Psychic Abduction
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only on your first turn. Shuffle 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Espurr
cards.text: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.

attacks.name: Energy Teaser
attacks.text: Move an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to another of their Pokémon.

cards.name: Meowstic
cards.text: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.

attacks.name: Teleportation Burst
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Honedge

abilities.name: Final Hour
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.

cards.name: Honedge
cards.text: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Doublade
cards.text: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

attacks.name: Curse of the Blade
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it.

cards.name: Aegislash
cards.text: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

attacks.name: Ticking Knock Out
attacks.text: During your next turn, if the Defending Pokémon is damaged by an attack, it will be Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Draining Blade
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Inkay
cards.text: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Malamar

abilities.name: Psychic Recharge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: It lures prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.

cards.name: Skrelp
cards.text: It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution.

cards.name: Dragalge

abilities.name: Poison Point
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.text: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Hoopa
cards.text: It gathers things it likes and passes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.

attacks.name: Hyperspace Ring
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Item cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Poipole
cards.text: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Knockout Reviver
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is Knocked Out, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.

cards.name: Naganadel-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Beast Raid
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Ultra Beasts in play.

attacks.name: Jet Needle
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Stinger-GX
attacks.text: Both players shuffle their Prize cards into their decks. Then, each player puts the top 3 cards of their deck face down as their Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Cubone
cards.text: The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead mother. According to some, it will evolve when it comes to terms with the pain of her death.

attacks.name: Burdensome Bone
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Torterra
cards.text: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Infernape

abilities.name: Flaming Fighter
abilities.text: Put 6 damage counters instead of 2 on your opponent's Burned Pokémon between turns.

cards.text: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

attacks.name: Burst Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Gible
cards.text: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Gabite
cards.text: Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the jewels it's amassed or Carbink it has caught.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Garchomp
cards.text: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.

attacks.name: Quick Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Royal Blades
attacks.text: If you played Cynthia from your hand during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

cards.name: Croagunk
cards.text: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Toxicroak
cards.text: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Exact Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Psychic Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

cards.name: Pancham
cards.text: There's no point to the leaf in its mouth, aside from an effort to look cool. It's mischievous, so it's not well suited to inexperienced Trainers.

attacks.name: Act Tough
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Binacle
cards.text: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.

attacks.name: Allotment
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Barbaracle
cards.text: Barbaracle's legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head's orders.

attacks.name: Seven Shock
attacks.text: If you have exactly 7 cards in your hand, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Tyrunt
cards.text: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up an automobile. It lived 100 million years ago.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Tyrantrum

abilities.name: Tyrannical Heart
abilities.text: As long as you don't have more Pokémon in play than your opponent, this Pokémon's attacks do 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance), and it takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Nothing could stop this Pokémon 100 million years ago, so it behaved like a king.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Hawlucha
cards.text: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.

attacks.name: Sky Drop
attacks.text: This attack does 20 less damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

cards.name: Zygarde

abilities.name: Earthen Aura
abilities.text: Damage from this Pokémon's attacks isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

cards.text: This is Zygarde's form when about 10% of its cells have been gathered. It runs across the land at speeds greater than 60 mph.

attacks.name: Peace Maker
attacks.text: If your opponent has an Ultra Beast in play, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Zygarde
cards.text: It's thought to be monitoring the ecosystem. There are rumors that even greater power lies hidden within it.

attacks.name: Glare
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Calm Strike
attacks.text: If you have used your GX attack, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Zygarde-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cell Connector
attacks.text: Attach 2 Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Verdict-GX
attacks.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Diancie ◇

abilities.name: Princess's Cheers
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, your Fighting Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

attacks.name: Diamond Rain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Rockruff
cards.text: This Pokémon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainer's side.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Lycanroc
cards.text: Bathed in the setting sun of evening, Lycanroc has undergone a special kind of evolution. An intense fighting spirit underlies its calmness.

attacks.name: Dangerous Rogue
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Buzzwole
cards.text: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.

attacks.name: Sledgehammer
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 4 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Pangoro
cards.text: From the slight twitches of its bamboo leaf, it deduces its opponent's movements. It's eager to tussle but kindhearted toward its companions.

attacks.name: Untamed Punch
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 more damage, and both Active Pokémon are now Confused.

attacks.name: Double Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Yveltal-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Absorb Vitality
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sonic Evil
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Doom Count-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has exactly 4 damage counters on it, that Pokémon is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Guzzlord
cards.text: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.

attacks.name: Lord's Valley
attacks.text: If you have exactly 2, 4, or 6 Prize cards remaining, discard the top 10 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Empoleon
cards.text: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

attacks.name: Total Command
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Dialga-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Overclock
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Timeless-GX
attacks.text: Take another turn after this one. (Skip the between-turns step.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Flabébé

abilities.name: Evolutionary Advantage
abilities.text: If you go second, this Pokémon can evolve during your first turn.

cards.text: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind's embrace with an untroubled heart.

cards.name: Flabébé
cards.text: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind's embrace with an untroubled heart.

attacks.name: Secret Blessings
attacks.text: Shuffle 3 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

cards.name: Floette
cards.text: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.

attacks.name: Swirling Petals
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. If you do, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Florges

abilities.name: Wondrous Gift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, put an Item card from your discard pile on top of your deck.

cards.text: In times long past, governors of castles would invite Florges to create flower gardens to embellish the castle domains.

attacks.name: Mist Guard
attacks.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Dragon Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Sylveon
cards.text: When this Pokémon sights its prey, it swirls its ribbonlike feelers as a distraction. A moment later, it pounces.

attacks.name: Wink Wink
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. You may discard a Supporter card you find there and use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

cards.name: Dedenne
cards.text: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Electrichain
attacks.text: If you have any Lightning Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Klefki
cards.text: It inserts its horn into chinks in metal, absorbing metal ions. For some reason, it collects keys.

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Fairy Lock
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Xerneas-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sanctuary-GX
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from each of your Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Goomy

abilities.name: Sticky Membrane
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more.

cards.text: Its source of protection is its slimy, germ-laden mucous membrane. Anyone who touches it needs some thorough hand-washing.

cards.name: Goomy
cards.text: Its source of protection is its slimy, germ-laden mucous membrane. Anyone who touches it needs some thorough hand-washing.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Sliggoo
cards.text: This Pokémon's mucous can dissolve anything. Toothless, it sprays mucous on its prey. Once they're nicely dissolved, it slurps them up.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Goodra

abilities.name: Hydration
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, heal 20 damage from it.

cards.text: It gets picked on because it's meek. But then, whoever teased it gets to feel the full force of its horns and a good swatting from its thick tail.

attacks.name: Soaking Horn
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was healed during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Ultra Necrozma-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Photon Geyser
attacks.text: Discard all basic Psychic Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Sky-Scorching Light-GX
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if the total of both players' remaining Prize cards is 6 or less. Put 6 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Arceus ◇

abilities.name: First Law
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon.

cards.text: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.

attacks.name: Trinity Star
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you have Grass, Water, and Lightning Pokémon on your Bench. Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Bunnelby
cards.text: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Diggersby
cards.text: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it's finished digging, it lounges lazily.

attacks.name: Mountaintop Mining
attacks.text: You may do 40 more damage. If you do, discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Rock Cannon
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Furfrou
cards.text: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokémon were the designated guardians of the king.

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

cards.name: Noibat
cards.text: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.

attacks.name: Destructive Sound
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard all Item cards you find there.

cards.name: Noivern
cards.text: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Resonance
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Confused, this attack does 70 more damage.

cards.name: Beast Ring
cards.text: You can play this card only if your opponent has exactly 3 or 4 Prize cards remaining.,Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Ultra Beasts. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Beast Ring
cards.text: You can play this card only if your opponent has exactly 3 or 4 Prize cards remaining.,Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Ultra Beasts. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Bonnie
cards.text: You can play this card only if there is any Stadium card in play.,Discard that Stadium card. During this turn, your Zygarde-GX can use its GX attack even if you have used your GX attack.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Crasher Wake
cards.text: Discard 2 Water Energy cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Diantha
cards.text: You can play this card only if 1 of your Fairy Pokémon was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn.,Put 2 cards from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Eneporter
cards.text: Move a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of their Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Fossil Excavation Map
cards.text: Choose 1: • Search your deck for an Unidentified Fossil card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. • Put an Unidentified Fossil card from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Judge
cards.text: Each player shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 4 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Lady
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 4 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Lysandre ◇
cards.text: For each of your Fire Pokémon in play, put a card from your opponent's discard pile in the Lost Zone.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).,◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

cards.name: Lysandre Labs
cards.text: Pokémon Tool cards in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no effect.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Metal Frying Pan
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Metal Pokémon this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance) and has no Weakness.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Metal Frying Pan
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Metal Pokémon this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance) and has no Weakness.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Mysterious Treasure
cards.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a Psychic or Dragon Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Mysterious Treasure
cards.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a Psychic or Dragon Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Ultra Recon Squad
cards.text: Discard up to 2 Ultra Beast cards from your hand. Draw 3 cards for each card you discarded in this way.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Ultra Space
cards.text: Once during each player's turn, that player may search their deck for an Ultra Beast card, reveal it, put it into their hand, and shuffle their deck.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Unidentified Fossil
cards.text: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Colorless Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may discard this card from play.,This card can't retreat.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Beast Energy ◇
cards.text: This card provides Colorless Energy.,While this card is attached to an Ultra Beast, it provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. The attacks of the Ultra Beast this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

cards.name: Unit Energy FDY
cards.text: This card provides Colorless Energy.,While this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Fighting, Darkness, and Fairy Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

cards.name: Palkia-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spatial Control
attacks.text: Move any number of Energy from your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pressure
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zero Vanish-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle all Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Greninja-GX

abilities.name: Shuriken Flurry
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Haze Slash
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Shadowy Hunter-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 130 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Naganadel-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Beast Raid
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Ultra Beasts in play.

attacks.name: Jet Needle
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Stinger-GX
attacks.text: Both players shuffle their Prize cards into their decks. Then, each player puts the top 3 cards of their deck face down as their Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Lucario-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aura Strike
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Riolu during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Cantankerous Beatdown-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Zygarde-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cell Connector
attacks.text: Attach 2 Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Verdict-GX
attacks.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Yveltal-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Absorb Vitality
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sonic Evil
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Doom Count-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has exactly 4 damage counters on it, that Pokémon is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Dialga-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Overclock
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Timeless-GX
attacks.text: Take another turn after this one. (Skip the between-turns step.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Xerneas-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
